contentrichtext.text: '''Veronica''' is a female given name ([[Veronica (given name)]]). It can also refer to: {{TOC right}} ==Botany== * [[Veronica (plant)|''Veronica'' (plant)]], a genus of plants * [[Hebe (genus)|''Hebe'' (genus)]], known as the shrubby veronicas, and formerly included in ''Veronica'' ==Film, radio and television== * [[Radio Veronica]], a defunct Dutch radio station (1960–1974) * [[Veronica (film)|''Veronica'' (film)]], a 1972 Romanian musical film directed by Elisabeta Bostan * [[Veronica (TV channel)]], a commercial television channel in the Netherlands * ''[[Veronica Mars]]'', an American television series (2004–2007) starring Kristen Bell as the title character ==Literature== * [[Veronica (1870 novel)|''Veronica'']], an 1870 novel by [[Frances Eleanor Trollope]] * [[Veronica (novel)|''Veronica'' (novel)]], a 2005 novel by [[Mary Gaitskill]] * ''Veronica'', an [[Archie Comics]] imprint centered on [[Veronica Lodge]] ==Music== ===Musicians=== * [[Veronica (singer)]], American dance-music singer * [[Veronika (singer)|VERONIKA]], American singer and songwriter from Ukraine * [[Veronica Ballestrini]], American country-music singer * [[Veronica Maggio]], Swedish pop star * [[Veronica Mehta]], English R&B singer with an Indian background * [[Veronika|Veronica Tecaru]], Afro-Romanian singer * [[The Veronicas]], an Australian twin-sister pop-rock duo ===Songs=== * [[Veronica (song)|"Veronica" (song)]], written by Elvis Costello and Paul McCartney, recorded by Costello ==Other== * [[Saint Veronica]] * [[Verónica (bullfighting)]], a technique in [[Spanish-style bullfighting]] * [[Veronica (search engine)]] * [[Verónica, Buenos Aires]], a town in Argentina ==Geography== * [[Willka Wiqi|Verónica]], a mountain in Peru ==See also== * {{look from}} * {{in title}} {{disambig}}
